oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Biology of Oxygen Radicals: an Overview
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Brown, Olen R.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: oxygen free radicals
neutrophil-mediated inflammatory processes
tissue injury
ischemic injury
reperfusion injury
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: I am privileged to introduce the subject of this symposium. My challenge is to provide a meaningful overview without usurping the subjects of the three speakers to follow. Therefore, I shall briefly review aspects of the potential roles of oxygen free radicals and specific biologic and pharmacologic defenses in: neutrophil-mediated inflammatory processes, in tissue injury from certain radical-generating pharmaceuticals and xenobiotics, and in ischemic/reperfusion injury.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: AAVPT Biennial Symposia; Fifth Biennial Symposium; 190-199
